description: Dive into "Romantic Escapes in Enchanting Split" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Romantic Escapes in Enchanting Split

places.generalDescription: Split Riva is a lively waterfront area with a wide boardwalk, various dining options, and picturesque vistas. The majority of the attractions are situated within the old town, including Diocletian's palace walls and gates, Peristyle square, St. Domnius Cathedral & Bell Tower, as well as cultural events like Christmas markets and summer concerts.

sources.snippet: The Riva or waterfront is one of my favourite places to hang out in Split. This is also one of the most popular public places in Split where city festivities and celebrations are held. It’s a pedestrianised space decorated with palm trees, wide walkways and seats to relax whilst enjoying the lovely view of Split Harbour.
sources.siteName: Collective Travel Guides - Inspire to Travel
sources.shortName: How To Spend A Perfect Week in Split Croatia

places.name: Split Riva

reviews.text: The best places to be in Split in the evening.  Was alive and gr8 vibes there as it was Saturday.  Had good food there .lot of Gelato  as the weather was hot . Lot of people. Lots of big boats and cruise ships parked in the marina.  The sun set was beautiful in Split

Very beautiful street by the sea in Split. This street is very well kept with his pretty plants and green spaces. There are also many benches with the double view. Y'all can also find the restaurants and bars throughout this way and many local small shops with interesting gadgets

A broad promenade lined with nice restaurants. On the seaward side you have several rows of palm trees and along the eastern section, many tour boat booths selling tickets for trips to the islands and swimming/snorkelling. On the north side of the promenade a variety of small shops.

places.generalDescription: Diocletian's Palace, located in Split, Croatia, was built for the Roman emperor Diocletian in the 4th century AD. Although referred to as a palace, it is more like a massive fortress with half of it serving as Diocletian's residence and the rest housing a military garrison. Today, this ancient site is part of Split's historic core and is listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

sources.snippet: Taking up a prime harborside position, the extraordinary complex of Diocletian's Palace is one of the most imposing ancient Roman structures in existence…
sources.shortName: attractions Split, Central Dalmatia

sources.snippet: Split was birthed when Roman Emperor Diocletian decided to build his retirement residence here in the late 3rd-century, and today it still hosts his sprawling palace that makes up nearly half of the historic centre. Walking the centuries-old streets is like taking a walk back through time. You’ll discover influences by the Greeks, Romans and Venetians in the magnificent ancient buildings and monuments, including the Cathedral of Saint Dominus, one of the oldest Catholic cathedrals in the world, constructed in 305 AD.
sources.shortName: Best Things To Do In Split in 2025 [by Local Experts] Zen Travel Croatia

sources.snippet: The huge maze-like complex called Diocletian’s Palace features many buildings that have survived from the late 3rd and early 4th centuries. Strolling the streets and alleyways is like walking back in time, with one of the best things to do in Split for couples simply getting lost among the delights, stealing kisses along the way. In addition to the Romans, see influences by the Greeks and Venetians in ancient monuments and buildings like Saint Dominus Cathedral.
sources.shortName: Most Romantic Things To Do In Split

sources.snippet: Led by a local guide, the tour invites couples to discover Diocletian’s Palace, capture captivating photos, and learn about the city’s intriguing past. Venture through the palace’s enchanting corners, then retreat to a nearby park for intimate moments. This personalized adventure promises an accessible, immersive experience that ignites romance amidst Croatia’s picturesque scenery.
sources.shortName: Gems of Split - Walking Tour for Couples

sources.snippet: The Diocletian’s Palace dates back to the 4th century and has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1979. A visit is definitely one of the best things to do in Split. This palace complex served as the retirement residence of the Roman Emperor Diocletian and forms a large part of the old town of Split, with the remains of about 200 buildings still well-preserved.
sources.shortName: 20 Amazing Things to Do in Split (Croatia)

sources.snippet: Diocletian’s Palace is an ancient Roman monument and a UNESCO World Heritage site. Built for Emperor Diocletian in the 4th century, it stands as a living part of the city’s bustling old town. The Golden Gate (locally called Zlatna Vrata) is the grandest and most significant of the four main gates of Diocletian’s Palace.
sources.shortName: Split Travel Guide: Romantic Tips, Attractions & Local Insights

sources.snippet: Split Croatia is worth visiting for its fascinating history which dates back to the era when the city was part of the Roman Empire up to the time of Venice rule and occupation by Italy during World War II. The Old Town in Split is home to one of Europe’s few completed remains of a Roman Palace, the Diocletian Palace.
sources.siteName: Collective Travel Guides - Inspire to Travel
sources.shortName: How To Spend A Perfect Week in Split Croatia

sources.snippet: Whether you are planning to propose or just want to organize something special for your loved one, a dinner in the heart of the Diocletian’s Palace is the most unique event in Split.
sources.shortName: Romantic Dinner on a Secret Location – Diocletian's Palace Split

places.name: Diocletian's Palace

reviews.text:
This is a must see on split. Drink up the atmosphere and engineering that has made this place last for so long. Great views from the Bell tower of the whole old town and across the bay. Very well priced and signage in English as well as other languages.
Can be busy when cruise ships are in but this is just the part of the hustle and bustle of life now in the city of Split.

Fantastic history.  Careful of the slippery tiles, smoothed from centuries of use.  The architecture is amazing and we spent a good day wandering around.
Early morning is better 'before' the crowds
Buy the 50euro 3 day pass in advance

The crowds were not too bad because it was the last day of August and school was already open.
The ancient stone and especially the one ancient wall remaining is always awe inspiring. To walk on these marble streets where people have walked for more than 2,000 years really inspires my curiosity about history.

places.generalDescription: The Saint Domnius Cathedral, also known as the Cathedral of St. Duje, is a historic site in Split, Croatia. Built in 305 CE as the Mausoleum of Diocletian, it is considered one of the oldest Catholic cathedrals still in use within its original structure. The cathedral features a Romanesque bell tower and is located within Diocletian's Palace.

sources.snippet: The Cathedral of Saint Domnius, located within Diocletian’s Palace, is a marvel of Romanesque architecture. Originally built as the mausoleum for Emperor Diocletian, it is one of the best-preserved ancient structures in Split. Its bell tower is a prominent feature of the city skyline.
sources.shortName: Split Travel Guide: Romantic Tips, Attractions & Local Insights

sources.snippet: Beautiful and one of the main places to see in Split is the impressive Cathedral of Saint Domnius, also known as Sveti Duje. A visit to this 4th century sacred site is almost a must on any city tour. It was once the mausoleum of the Roman emperor Diocletian and his wife Prisca.
sources.shortName: 20 Amazing Things to Do in Split (Croatia)

sources.snippet: Saint Domnius Cathedral is the second oldest Catholic cathedral in the world. It was built during the 4th century AD initially as a grave for the Roman Emperor Diocletian.
sources.siteName: Collective Travel Guides - Inspire to Travel
sources.shortName: How To Spend A Perfect Week in Split Croatia
Gems of Split - Walking Tour for Couples

places.name: Saint Domnius’ Cathedral

reviews.text: This is really quite a special place for those of Catholic faith. It's considered to be the oldest Catholic Cathedral in the world that remains in use in it's original structure, consecrated at the beginning of the 7th Century. Beautiful altars and paintings adorn the interior. It's well worth combining a visit here with the Bell Tower which provides you with magnificent views of the city.

Very nice building with beautiful golden interior.
If you are able to climb steep stairs I recommend to visit the tower (costs extra), the view gives you a complete overview over Split.
Great!

Absolutely stunning, this is a must see if you are in Croatia. I highly suggest taking a guided walking tour with an expert as there are so many aspects to this palace. You get a sense of feel of the history, the culture, the different times in the different centuries. This is a great place to visit for somebody who is into architecture, going back to the 15th and 16th century, where you can see the architectural influences going back into the generations, just based on the stones that were used in the different sections of the cathedral.

places.address: Ul. Kraj Svetog Duje 3, 21000, Split, Croatia

places.generalDescription: Konoba Laganini is a charming local restaurant in Split, Croatia that beautifully blends culinary traditions with innovative approaches. The menu is thoughtfully tailored to accommodate various dietary preferences and restrictions, offering options for vegetarians and those with sensitivities. Known for its elegant ambiance and flavorful seafood dishes, it's an ideal spot for a sophisticated dining experience. With both indoor and outdoor seating available, guests can enjoy fresh and delicious food in a cozy setting surrounded by stone walls.

sources.snippet: Konoba Laganini is a beautiful local restaurant where its culinary traditions are deeply rooted in history, yet their innovative approach brings excitement to every dish. They tailor their menu to accommodate various dietary preferences and restrictions, offering great options for vegetarians and specialties for those with gluten, lactose, or nut sensitivities. Food is fresh, bright and delicious, a must try.
sources.shortName: Split Croatia for Couples

places.name: LAGANINI seafood • pasta • steak

reviews.text:
The food and service were superb. We struggled a bit on what to order, but at the end we sought advice from the staff. It turned out that every single dish was amazing. The cooking style in Croatia in general may not cater to Asian palates, but those with an open mind will discover its wonders!

Credit to Marco for detailed introduction to each dishes and wine! From the origin of food to how to elevate the flavour of food with different seasoning!

The service in the restaurant was very good. The salt mixed with olive oil to put on  the bread was handmade and very tasty. The starter of prawns, tuna and swordfish was very tasty and made use of the ingredients as they are. The risotto and pasta we had as a main course were also delicious. The quality of the restaurant was excellent, without being spoilt by the richness of being in the old town. I would definitely recommend it!

Wonderful evening, dishes are top notch, and the service amazing (we finally found the level of service we are used to!!) ambiance of 4 just because we were seated in the e small alley and had a lot of passages. We enjoyed it so much that we even checked if this was a bib gourmand from Michelin! Highly recommend

places.address: Ulica Kraj Svetog Ivana 2, 21000, Split, Croatia

places.generalDescription: Located in Split, Ćiri Biri Bela is an adults-only hostel with a bohemian-chic restaurant and terrace. The hostel offers a pleasant stay for both business and leisure travelers, conveniently located near various attractions. The upscale restaurant, situated in a romantic courtyard of an authentic Dalmatian stone house, has been highly rated for its eclectic menu featuring locally sourced produce and international cuisines.

sources.snippet: Plinarska ulica  6      | +385 95 798 4963      |     Upscale ($$$$). Located in a romantic courtyard of an authentic Dalmatian stone house, at the edges of Varoš neighborhood, Ćiri Biri Bela have been topping the local restaurant leaderboards of Google Reviews and TripAdvisor. With an eclectic menu inspired by their chef and founder’s Ćiro Sabljić love for locally sourced produce and the national cuisines of the world, Ćiri Biri Bela boasts with an unique blend of classic Croatian dishes mixed with contemporary food trends.
sources.shortName: 7 Fancy Restaurants to Try for a Romantic Dinner in Split

places.name: Ćiri Biri Bela

reviews.text: This place is by far the best breakfast in Split. There were so many options and the food was simply delicious. The staff were very accommodating to adjustments in the menu. It wasn't just about quantity here, it was the quality too! Everything was unreal and I left feeling satisfied and absolutely stuffed! Coffees were also great! I also can't believe how reasonable the price was for the variety, quantity and quality of the food! Would love to go again sometime soon.

Amazing. Just amazing. Our waitress was absolutely amazing! I personally felt very seen when she offered a shot to us, and without me asking she gave me a non-alcoholic shot because she noticed that I did not drink while my partner did. This type of service is rare and really great.

The food is also so flavourful. It was a nice experience. After we left we immediately made another reservation for later this week. RESERVATION IS NEEDED.

Our favourite restaurant in Split! Really two menus, flatbread pizzas and small plate menu. We had the small plates on two occasions and each plate was delicious. The service was fast and friendly. The food was delicious and varied. Do not hesitate to select this restaurant but prepare to make reservations, it is a popular spot!

places.generalDescription: Bokamorra Haute Couture Pizza & Cocktails, also known as a "Pizzaurant," offers a luxurious dining experience with its upscale setting and sumptuous Neapolitan-style pizzas. While it is the highest priced among its peers, it still offers reasonable prices compared to other restaurants in town. The menu features a variety of pizza options, including traditional choices like Margherita and unique creations such as the Shrimp pizza.

sources.snippet: The generous glass frontage of Bokamorra allows diners to make the most of the views but, in truth, the lovely interior of the restaurant and the wonderful presentation of their pizzas and cocktails are more than enough to keep your attention inside. Pizzas are all they do, including a dessert option but, luckily, theirs are the best in town. Delicious pizza base is made freshly from dough aged for 48 hours, topped with high-quality ingredients such as cheeses, truffles, salad leaves and air-dried meats.
sources.shortName: Split restaurants | Restaurants

sources.snippet: Pizzeria | $$ | Why We Love It: The best pizza in Split, Croatia!. Feeling like eating pizza in Split?. Bokamorra is our go-to place for best pizza in Split.
sources.siteName: Croatia Travel Guide and Consultation Services for Croatia
sources.shortName: Where to Eat in Split, Croatia: 11 Top Restaurants That Locals Love

places.name: BOKAMORRA HAUTE COUTURE PIZZA & COCKTAILS

reviews.text:
I was surprised by the dough quality, which is really nice. Margarita and mushroom pizza were both tasty, but for me, Tartufizza (with mushrooms) has too intense flavor, mostly because of the cheese with truffle. Therefore, I can't say that the pizza was exceptionally delicious, at least for us. However we really liked the package.
What about service? There are no cons. The waitress was lovely, and we didn't wait long. It took approximately 10 minutes for our order to be done. Additionally, the whole atmosphere was pleasant. Everything looked clean, and people were friendly.

Based on a recommendation from our host, as one of the best pizza restaurants in Split, we figured we would try it, not impressed.

The crust was very thin and tasty, but not completely cooked in a few areas of my pizza.  The tomato sauce was kind of thick but had the taste of a spice I was not expecting on pizza, might have been fresh oregano and the cheese had no taste at all.

The restaurant has a bar atmosphere with loud music and loud conversations.

Overall, not bad pizza but not traditional flavors at all.

This place is built for the young and the nostalgic, 80s pop hits, and a lively crowd. The staff are genuinely friendly and impressively efficient, keeping the energy upbeat and the service smooth.

The pizza looks great: thick, charred crust with quality toppings like black olives, capers, and anchovies. Ingredients are fresh and well chosen. But structurally, it's a mixed bag. The edge is thick and almost deep-dish, while the center is thin and soggy from too much tomato sauce. It leans Neapolitan, but the balance is off.

Great for a fun night out with good vibes and solid service.

places.generalDescription: Šug Restaurant, located in Split, is a bright and elegant eatery that serves modern Dalmatian cuisine with a touch of innovation. The restaurant was established by two young chefs who drew inspiration from their childhood experiences on the islands. Their menu features traditional recipes prepared with fresh local ingredients. Šug has gained recognition from the Michelin guide, earning a Bib Gourmand rating for its excellent quality and value.

sources.snippet: Modern Dalmatian | $$$ | Why We Love It: Food, Service, Value For Money. Restaurant Sug is the only Michelin Bib Gourmand restaurant in Split, Croatia. This neighborhood eatery attracts tourists and locals with its exquisite cuisine, carefully selected local wines, friendly service, and welcoming ambiance.
sources.siteName: Croatia Travel Guide and Consultation Services for Croatia
sources.shortName: Where to Eat in Split, Croatia: 11 Top Restaurants That Locals Love

places.name: Šug Restaurant

reviews.text: We loved this place. They for sure deserve to get one Michelin star. Top notch service by Antonella and Bodjo (?). We ordered the excellent steak tartar, then the veal risotto, which I so much wanted to take one home.. my wife had the tuna. The star of the night was the traditional split dessert called Snenokle.. we found the recipe online and we will try to make it back at home.

We came across this place online and wanted to check it out, since it has three straight Michelin Bib Gourmand awards. The menu was varied, and all sounded so good, so we had the three course tasting menu (€55) with wine pairings (+€30). The chef kindly completed us with an additional amuse bouche and sparkling wine on the house, which was so amazing. All the courses were 10/10, the portions were generous, the wine was lovely, and it was served with a smile from our knowledgeable waiter. Wish I could eat here every night!

We had a three-course meal recommended by the chef. The starter, the braised deer, the tuna steak and the final dessert were all very good. At 55€ for this quality, it was good value for money. The house wine recommended by the restaurant staff was also excellent.

places.generalDescription: Villa Spiza is a charming and unpretentious restaurant located in the old town of Split. The place exudes an authentic and cozy atmosphere, with a dog lounging on the doorstep and a kitchen filled with the enticing aroma of garlic. The menu at Villa Spiza changes daily based on the fresh ingredients sourced from local markets, fishermen, and butchers.

sources.snippet: One of the best little restaurants in Split, Villa Spiza, lies in the heart of Split’s Old Town, near Diocletian’s Palace and the medieval part of the city. It’s a superb place for traditional Dalmatian-style home cooking, so if you’re someone who enjoys local food while traveling, this is a must-visited Split restaurant for you. Villa Spiza is tiny, though, and can accommodate only ten guests, so, you might have to wait for a little.
sources.shortName: 17 Things To Do In Split, Croatia For Families, Singles & Couples

sources.snippet: Traditional Dalmatian | $$ | Why We Love It: Food, Atmosphere, Value For Money. Villa Spiza is a charming restaurant in Split’s old town, tucked away in a small alley. Don’t hesitate to ask locals for directions, as Villa Spiza is tricky to find.
sources.siteName: Croatia Travel Guide and Consultation Services for Croatia
sources.shortName: Where to Eat in Split, Croatia: 11 Top Restaurants That Locals Love

places.name: Villa Spiza

reviews.text: My friend and I had a delicious dinner here. The food was so fresh, flavourful, and piping hot when it came out. Menu recommendations from the staff were perfect. Well priced food and wine. Great vibes with people singing along to the music, a cute baby getting passed around while parents ate, and the neighbour's dog asleep on the floor. Authentic Croatian food with a completely welcoming local experience. Absolute gem and I'll definitely go back.

This is our favorite restaurant in Split! Of everywhere we went our whole trip, this place ticked all the boxes - delicious food, cozy atmosphere, and wonderful service. Their menu changes every day, but has a wide variety of options! Pasta, seafood, and other meat entrees are regulars on the menu. We got the bolognese, tomato & mozzarella pasta, veal chops, and pork tenderloin; all of which were delicious. You can't miss the
tiramisu, either! 10/10 recommend!! Do note that they don't take reservations, so either show up at a slower time to guarantee seating, or be prepared to wait a little while :)

This is a very small family operated restaurant on the north side of the palace just on the south side of the wall. There are only about 8 or 9 tables so recommend you come early as they are popular and they don't take reservations. Menu changes every day and they actively cross out items on the hand written menu as they run out of ingredients. Excellent fresh food they make right when you order. Very reasonable prices for the area and friendly and efficient staff.

places.generalDescription: Bokeria Kitchen & Wine is a stylish restaurant and bar in Split, named after Barcelona's La Boqueria market. It combines the concept of a high-end restaurant and a wine bar, attracting international celebrities. The interior design is spectacular, making it one of the city's most recognizable locations. Bokeria offers pan-Mediterranean cuisine and an extensive wine list, perfect for wine lovers.

sources.snippet: The owners of Bokeria, the Bokavšek family, are at pains to explain that the reason for naming their establishment after the famous market in Barcelona was to bring a spirit of diversity to Split. Judging by the growing popularity of this place since opening in 2014, that’s what they’ve achieved. Bokeria is set in a building that once was a hardware store, and site of a few failed ventures before someone finally managed to fill this vast space.
sources.shortName: Split restaurants | Restaurants

sources.snippet: Speaking of good wine selection, Bokeria Kitchen & Wine is a place for all hungry wine lovers. Bokeria is set in the historical centre of Split and makes great use of the beautiful historic building it occupies. Food on the menu is mostly Mediterranean in its essence and relies heavily on the quality of primary ingredients and delightful simplicity.
sources.shortName: Where to Stay and Eat in Split in 2022?

sources.snippet: Domaldova ulica 8      | +385 21 355 577 |     Upscale ($$$$). Since opening back in 2014, Bokeria has established itself as one of the leader of Split’s restaurant scene. The eye-dropping interior and authentic location in one of the livelier corners of the Old Town, gives Bokeria a special kind of urban Mediterranean vibe.
sources.shortName: 7 Fancy Restaurants to Try for a Romantic Dinner in Split

sources.snippet: Bokeria Kitchen & Wine is located in the heart of Split’s Historic Old Town. It is a stylish eatery that offers international bar bites, entrees and drinks. We loved their burrata salad, their bread with olive oil and their pastas.
sources.shortName: Split Croatia for Couples

sources.snippet: Situated on a beautiful piazza in the city’s center, Bokeria Kitchen & Wine Bar is a fantastic place to go for a traditional Dalmatian meal and a good glass of wine.
sources.shortName: 17 Things To Do In Split, Croatia For Families, Singles & Couples

places.name: Bokeria Kitchen & Wine

reviews.text: I asked the waiter for local dish. He recommended the black ink risotto and the flat bread with stuffing inside. It was divine! Especially to the black ink risotto. Even the pasta was equally delicious. The waiter himself was very helpful with the recommendation and great service! We paid 98 eur for our bill. Though it was a little pricey, it was worth it.

We did not just have a meal here but really a full on experience. Marco, our waiter, was friendly, knowledgeable, and perfectly attentive. Each bite of food was delicious and Marco's Croatian wine recommendation paired incredibly. The atmosphere in the small streets of Split cannot be beat. This place is a must try!

We started with the burrata and then enjoyed the pasta and the lamb shank for our mains.  Would recommend all three!

We had a very disappointing experience here and definitely will not return.

For starters, we ordered the soup and the codfish spring roll. The spring roll was the only decent thing we had crispy, flavorful, and well done. Unfortunately, the soup was a complete letdown. It was bland and absolutely no richness or depth you'd expect from a restaurant charging these prices.

For mains, I had the squid ink risotto and my husband had the Angus beef. After our starters, we were left waiting almost 20 minutes for the mains. The risotto was dull, lacking any balance or seasoning, and had an unpleasant aftertaste. The Angus beef was chewy and poorly cooked, paired with mashed potatoes that were supposed to be elevated with truffle oil. As a country that actually produces truffles, this version was shockingly below standard flat, oily, and with none of the fragrant quality you'd expect.

Service made the experience even worse. We were given a completely different menu from another table, which left us questioning whether there was some form of bias or discrimination happening. And when we asked for the bill, a female server simply pointed her finger at my original (male) server, refusing to assist and continuing her personal chat instead. Completely unprofessional, dismissive, and unacceptable for a place that positions itself as “above average.”

Overall: long waiting times, overpriced dishes, inconsistent menus, poor service, and food that is far below the mark in flavor and execution. One good spring roll can't save an otherwise awful dining experience.

places.generalDescription: Dvor is a popular restaurant in Split, Croatia, known for its diverse culinary offerings. The restaurant scene in Split features chefs from various countries such as Italy, France, Japan, Morocco, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, the UAE and Croatia. These chefs have been recognized with prestigious awards including Michelin stars and Gault&Millau caps. Dvor is one of the 18 restaurants where these acclaimed chefs showcase their talents.

sources.snippet: Situated just above the coastal path that works its way east from Bačvice Beach, Dvor is  a uniquely calming place from which to admire the inviting silhouettes of Šolta and Brač across the water. Sit in the conservatory or venture out onto the terrace shaded by trees. Dvor functions perfectly both as café and restaurant – fish, steak and fowl are fired up on the open grill overlooking the lawn outside, and there’s an excellent choice of Croatian wines by the glass.
sources.shortName: Split restaurants | Restaurants

sources.snippet: Modern Dalmatian | $$$$ | Why We Love It: Seafront Location, Food, Terrace. Restaurant Dvor is among locals’ favorite dining spots in Split, Croatia, for its stunning seafront location just steps from Firule Beach, the beautiful terrace, and excellent food. Under the guidance of head chef Hrvoje Zirojevic, one of Croatia’s best chefs, cooks create top-quality dishes like raw tuna with goose liver, pork crackling candy with bacon chips, smoked sea risotto, and ravioli in wild rabbit sauce.
sources.siteName: Croatia Travel Guide and Consultation Services for Croatia
sources.shortName: Where to Eat in Split, Croatia: 11 Top Restaurants That Locals Love

sources.snippet: Put Firula 14      | +385 21 571 513      |     Upscale ($$$$). Set amidst the pine trees overlooking the tranquil Firule Bay, Dvor is an exquisite international restaurant with a very busy bar. Selected by both Michelin’s Guide and Gault & Millau as one of the best places to eat at in Split, Dvor’s balanced menu balancing includes both meat and fish dishes, many of which have been inspired by traditional Dalmatian cooking.
sources.shortName: 7 Fancy Restaurants to Try for a Romantic Dinner in Split

sources.snippet: Restaurant Dvor is overlooking sandy beach and it is just a short walk from the center. It is probably my favorite romantic restaurant in Split. Restaurant Dvor offers high-end Mediterranean cuisine as well as traditional Dalmatian dishes.
sources.shortName: BEST ROMANTIC RESTAURANTS IN SPLIT – Excursion Dalmatia

places.name: Dvor

reviews.text:
We had a really great time dining at Dvor - not in small part because of our fantastic waiter Tom! He was charming, funny, and really kind. Made our visit very special.

The food was delicious and reasonably priced for a Michelin star restaurant. The carpaccio and smoked risotto were standouts. Atmosphere was very chill and romantic, with a lovely view of the sea. Was nice to also be a little outside of the busy old town area.

Only complaint is that the wines we were recommended, while very delicious, were also VERY expensive. Would have been nice to get a warning that we were about to drop 20 euros each on glasses of wine.

All in all, was a great experience and would definitely recommend it!

The hostess that greeted us was very kind, our server was incredibly knowledgeable and had a great sense of humor. We decided to do the tasting menu,  as we wanted a little bit of everything.  EVERY bite was delicious,  great portions,  and they were served in a very leisurely manner. It was perfect. A bit expensive,  but worth it. if you want a true Croatian food experience,  I highly recommend treating yourself here.

We had a wonderful dinner at Dvor. The restaurant has a truly beautiful setting with a great view of the sea, which creates a relaxed and elegant atmosphere. The service was attentive and welcoming throughout the evening.

We tried the Smoked Risotto, white fish and a steak – everything was fresh, well-prepared and full of flavor. Each dish was nicely presented and it paired perfectly with the setting.

Overall, an excellent combination of location, atmosphere, and food. Highly recommended if you're in Split and want a memorable seaside dining experience.

places.generalDescription: The Meštrović Gallery, located in Split, Croatia, is a cultural gem showcasing the works of renowned 20th-century sculptor Ivan Meštrović. Housed in a neo-classical villa built by the artist himself in 1931, the gallery offers a comprehensive display of his sculptures, including statues and portraits reflecting Classical, folk, and Modernist influences.

sources.shortName: attractions Split, Central Dalmatia

sources.snippet: If you want to learn more about Croatia’s most famous modern sculptor, you can visit the Ivan Mestrovic Gallery which sits within the holiday home where Mestrovic once spent many summers. He designed the house, built in the 1930s, before donating the property and 100 works of art to the state in 1952. The gallery preserves his most significant works, including drawings, sculpture, architecture and furniture.
sources.shortName: Best Things To Do In Split in 2025 [by Local Experts] Zen Travel Croatia

sources.snippet: The Ivan Meštrović Gallery is an art museum just outside the Old Town dedicated to the work of the 20th century sculptor Ivan Meštrović. In addition to Meštrović’s most important works, the gallery also features drawings, sketches, newspaper articles and photographs by the artist. The area is also picturesque, as the museum has a pleasant garden and a nice café with a gorgeous view of the sea.
sources.shortName: 20 Amazing Things to Do in Split (Croatia)

sources.snippet: The gallery offers an intimate ambiance with stunning sculptures and romantic art pieces created by the renowned artist, Ivan Meštrović.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Split: Top Activities for Couples

places.name: Meštrović Gallery

reviews.text: Lovely garden and sculptures. Unfortunately the building is being renovated so you can't enter the building. But tickets were half price, and included entry to the church just down the road. The sculptures were well worth a look.

Nice decent price unfortunately a lot of the gallery was closed when we visited but the tickets were discounted. Spacious and tranquil, really helpful and friendly staff who directed us to the church down the road which had a beautiful coastal view. And nice toilet's probably some of the best in Split.

What a gorgeous location.

During my visit the gallery was closed due to renovations, so I was only able to visit the gardens featuring about a dozen sculptures. Nothing was labeled (or I completely missed this), probably can buy a guide at the ticket office/gift shop.

The architecture and gardens are beautiful, it was very serene with a few visitors around. Stunning views of the Adriatic and a reasonably nice view of the Marjan hill (the cross and the flag) due to construction work.

The tickets were discounted and also included entry to Crikvine-Kaštelet, located a 10-minute walk up the road.

places.generalDescription: Nestled within the walls of Diocletian's Palace, Makarun Split offers a serene escape from the bustling center of Split. The restaurant is tucked behind the Milesi mansion and a 70-year-old fig tree, providing an idyllic setting for savoring Mediterranean cuisine crafted from seasonal ingredients sourced from their organic garden. Guests can also enjoy a private terrace with exclusive views while being guided through an unforgettable dining experience by Makarun's chef and sommelier.

sources.snippet: Makarun is a locals’ favorite, not only due to its superb service and ambiance, but also because of its outstanding culinary experience. Quiet, tucked away from the hustle and bustle, this little nook of heaven will certainly deliver on both food and drink. A great place to celebrate romance.
sources.shortName: Split Croatia for Couples

places.name: Makarun Split

reviews.text:
This was our second visit to Makarun - this time for lunch - and once again it was an absolute highlight of our time in Split. The restaurant masterfully combines fresh, local ingredients with modern presentation and preparation, offering a culinary experience that feels both authentic and refined.

We were lucky to have Toni as our waiter – his warmth, attention to detail, and genuine passion for food and wine made our visit truly unforgettable. We couldn't decide on just one dish, so we ended up sharing everything – and it was the best decision we could've made!

We started with the Sea Selection, a beautifully arranged tasting of seven bite-sized seafood delights, followed by the Roasted Squid Salad – tender squid served over arugula with roasted nuts and capers, absolutely delicious.

For our mains, we shared the Sea Makaruni – technically an appetizer, but a must-try signature dish featuring hand-rolled makaruni in a rich cognac shrimp sauce – and a perfectly cooked sea bass fillet with toasted polenta, vegetable ragout, and broccoli purée.

We couldn't resist dessert either: a light citrus meringue with berries and a decadent chocolate cake that blew us away. Each course was paired with exquisite wines from Korčula, the owner's home island – a lovely personal touch.

But honestly, what makes Makarun truly special is the people. Toni's knowledge and enthusiasm elevated the entire visit. His recommendations, storytelling, and infectious love for great cuisine turned this meal into an experience we'll never forget.

We'll definitely be back next time we're in Split. Highly, highly recommended!

I don't even know where to start… this restaurant was just ‘chef's kiss'. It wasn't even on our radar until the person who checked us into our hotel recommended it when we asked for suggestions. I love the history behind the place, and how every makarun is handmade. Not only did I feel special eating each makarun, but it also tasted absolutely amazing! We were only in Split for a day, but I made sure to return here during our last few days in Croatia, even though it was out of our way. That's how good it was. Though a little pricey, it was worth it (for me at least). The desserts were phenomenal as well. I'll be dreaming of this restaurant until we come back to Croatia.

We had the vegetarian 5-course menu, which highlighted food from the restaurant's own garden. It was inventive, varied, and beautifully presented.

The accompanying wine pairings proved equally surprising, in a good way.

The staff were friendly and accommodating - letting us move to a cooler spot, and doing a great job of combining precision and informality.

Highly recommended.

places.generalDescription: Located in the heart of Diocletian's Palace, Fig Split is a stylish restaurant set in a fifteenth-century courtyard. The menu features a limited selection of dishes inspired by diverse world cuisines, reflecting the founders' extensive travels. With high rankings on TripAdvisor and Google Reviews, this restaurant offers a fresh and lively dining experience. Visitors praise the delicious food and friendly waitstaff, making it a must-visit spot in Split for both lunch and dinner.

sources.snippet: Dioklecijanova ulica 1      | +385 21 784 7620      |     Moderately Priced ($$$). Nestled in a fantastic fifteenth century courtyard within the heart of the Diocletian’s Palace, on the ancient  cardo  street between the Peristyle and the Golden Gates, Fig Split is a stylish restaurant serving some delicious food from all around the world. They boast with a limited number of menu items whose inspiration comes from a surprisingly diverse number of world cuisines, which have been popular with the crowds as Fig is high on the local restaurant leaderboards of both TripAdvisor and Google Review rankings.
sources.shortName: 7 Fancy Restaurants to Try for a Romantic Dinner in Split

places.name: Fig Split

reviews.text:
Our favourite place for breakfast and lunch while we were in Split! We came for lunch initially and were impressed with how tasty the chicken quesadillas and the potatoes were - their homemade sauces were incredible! The food is filled with so much flavour. Then we had to try for breakfast the next day which was just as delicious. Both times we were served by Aline who was a lovely host - gave us superb recommendations of places to try in Split too.

Beautiful outdoor seating in the sun or the inside which is also gorgeous. Come here for beautiful atmosphere, great service and food you can't fault!

In the heart of Diocletian's Palace, Fig is a hot spot for diners. First come, first served resulted in a 20 minute wait to be seated for brunch around 11am on a high season day in August. The breakfast menu is limited, but the dishes are prepared well and in generous portions. The courtyard seating is lovely, yet we were thankful to be seated inside as it was an extremely hot day. We dined on the vegetarian breakfast burrito, spicy eggs, and granola bowl. Lovely experience.

There was a little bit of a wait but the setting and food was incredible, so it so worth the wait.

You can either sit outside in a little plaza area with the old walls around you, or inside within the building with the old walls around you. It's a stunning setting.

The service was quick and so friendly, and the food was amazing. So delicious and huge portions. I feel like anything on the menu is guaranteed delicious.

places.generalDescription: Matoni is a charming restaurant located to the southeast of the Old Town of Split, offering an incredibly atmospheric dining experience with its arched stone ceilings and cozy brick walls. The restaurant is well-known for its hearty Mediterranean cuisine, including Dalmatian specialties and mouthwatering desserts. Matoni prides itself on its creative menu, which includes options for vegans and those with gluten-free dietary needs.

sources.snippet: Located to the southeast of the Old Town of Split, Konoba Matoni is an incredibly atmospheric restaurant. Its curved, dome-like stone ceilings and brick walls, together with incredible lighting, make this is a romantic and cozy place to grab dinner. A well-rated restaurant, it serves Dalmatian and Mediterranean cuisine, including vegan dishes and mouthwatering desserts.
sources.shortName: 17 Things To Do In Split, Croatia For Families, Singles & Couples

sources.snippet: Konoba ma:Toni is a charming restaurant close to Bacvice and the ferry port. It focuses on general Mediterranean inspired dishes. The key are locally sourced ingredients and seasonally changed menu.
sources.shortName: Where to Stay and Eat in Split in 2022?

places.name: Matoni

reviews.text:
We had a wonderful experience dining here last night.  Great atmosphere and a really friendly and helpful server that gave us recommendations on wines and meals to order.  The tuna tartare was one of the best we have experienced and the steaks were well seasoned and cooked to order.  We'll definitely come back here again when in the area.
Finally, not sure on the comments that this place is expensive, and it really depends where you are traveling in from as we thought it was good value for money.  You would be paying waaay more for a similar dining experience of the same quality in California, Seattle, New York and London for example.

Great restaurant, the cellar vibe us beautiful.
Fantastic service, delicious wine and great produce. Everything would have been 5 star if there hadn't been a policy of no tap water, this has let them down
We ordered the tuna tartar, cevicipi and duck risotto. All excellent

Overall, the place feels quite welcoming and the food is fairly good, but the service leaves a bit to be desired. We tried the meat and the famous Croatian ćevapčići. The food was decent but nothing exceptional. As for the service, unfortunately, the dishes didn't arrive at the table at the same time, so we ended up having to eat practically separately. The bill was in line with the average prices of other places in the area, which, however, are now expensive compared to the rest of Europe.

places.generalDescription: Kasjuni Beach is a top choice for those seeking a stunning beach experience in Split. Located on the western shores of Marjan, it offers a picturesque view with cliffs surrounding the deep bay. Visitors can enjoy various amenities such as a cafe bar, restaurant, cabana and lounge chair rentals, massages, and water sports activities like parasailing and stand-up paddle boarding at Joes Beach & Lounge Bar.

sources.snippet: Near the tip of the peninsula, Kašjuni is Split's most appealing beach, due largely to its green surroundings and stylish beach bar.
sources.shortName: attractions Split, Central Dalmatia

sources.snippet: Split is surrounded by gorgeous beaches and Kasjuni Beach is just a short distance outside the city centre. Overlooked by a grove of pine trees, the secluded setting means that relaxing here is one of the best things to do in Split for couples. A pebbly and sandy stretch, it’s edged by crystal-clear azure waters that make it easy to see the colourful fish that dart below the surface.
sources.shortName: Most Romantic Things To Do In Split

sources.snippet: The beach at Kašjuni has a long breakwater that helps to protect you from the wind. This beach is a low-key city getaway with showers, toilets, and a cafe, making it perfect for families.
sources.shortName: 17 Things To Do In Split, Croatia For Families, Singles & Couples

places.name: Kasjuni Beach

reviews.text: This place is just amazing. I went here during August in weekday and the crowd was okay, so not too many people. The beach is actually clean and the water as y'all can see from the photos is wonderful. The place has a bar with music too (maybe kinda expensive, but this is Split :/

A large, free pebble beach with crystal-clear water and no waves. There are two bars with loungers and umbrellas, few restrooms, a small free parking lot near the beach and another small one uphill. The bus stop is a 10-minute walk from the beach.
One side is protected by nature, offering some shade, while the central area is completely open for sunbathing. Bring the essentials: water and food, snorkeling gear, shoes, and possibly a tent for sun protection.
In early September, it's not crowded, and the blue water temperature is perfect for bathing.
There's a small dog area on one side and a nudist area on the other.

Wonderful beach just a couple minute drive from the center of Split. The water was crystal clear and the overall atmosphere was also amazing. The views were great, and overall just a good spot to escape the city. Just beware, it gets crowded pretty quickly.

places.generalDescription: Restaurant Bajamonti is a true gem in the heart of Split, perfectly situated at the end of the Riva and nestled within the vibrant Prokurative square. This charming eatery not only boasts stunning views of the Adriatic Sea but also offers an inviting atmosphere enhanced by seasonal floral decorations on each table. The service here is exceptional, with staff who go above and beyond to make your dining experience memorable—like remembering your preferences from previous visits!

sources.snippet: You will find this great restaurant on Prokurative Square, a charming Mediterranean square with busy terraces. One of the best restaurants in Croatia, its menu features everything from meat to fish and seafood. Its dishes are a work of art, well-presented and delicious.
sources.shortName: 17 Things To Do In Split, Croatia For Families, Singles & Couples

places.name: Bajamonti Pizza, Steak & Fish House

reviews.text: What a fabulous place to eat & drink - it's worth visiting just for the tenderloin steak!! Zoran was our waiter and helped us enormously with the menu, extremely polite and friendly throughout our visit to this lovely restaurant. Great food, great staff, great view, great for people watching! We will definitely be returning next time we are in Split. Prices were very reasonable for such a prime location, and cheaper than we found elsewhere in the old town.

Bajamonti was a pleasant surprise indeed. The food was delicious - we went for the seabass for 2 and the monkfish. My girls had the margerita pizza which they cleaned off quickly.
Service was lovely and they even kindly re-seated us outside once the rain had stopped at my request. Nothing seemed to be a bother and our waiter was fantastic. He filleted the fish in style and ensured we were comfortable.
The atmosphere in the square was truly lovely and lively, whilst not being too loud serving a pleasant environment to dine in.
I would highly recommend a visit here!

Everything was great..the food was amazing, the drinks were nice, and the service was impeccable.  We had "Mrva" as  waiter and he made sure multiple times that everything was to our liking. All tourists should pay this place a visit while in Split.

places.generalDescription: Zinfandel Food & Wine Bar is a chic and modern establishment situated in the historic center of Split. The bar, named after the famous Croatian Zinfandel grape, boasts a diverse menu featuring Mediterranean-inspired dishes paired with an impressive selection of Dalmatian wines. With a warm and inviting ambiance, patrons can enjoy live music while indulging in elegantly crafted meals and a variety of shared platters that include cold cuts, artisan cheeses, and marinated seafood.

sources.snippet: Known for being quintessentially Dalmatian, Zinfandel is a small bar and eatery with informal seating, a delightful menu packed with local ingredients, and a wine selection that boasts varieties from Croatia’s best vineyards and boutique winemakers. If you are in the mood for a classy yet casual meal served by friendly staff who know what’s what when it comes to wine and Croatia’s wine history, this is the perfect little joint.
sources.shortName: 17 Things To Do In Split, Croatia For Families, Singles & Couples

sources.snippet: Zinfandel Food & Wine Bar enjoys a central location in a narrow backstreet within the palace walls and boasts a wine list with over 100 wines from Croatia and across the globe. Wines can be ordered by the glass or by the bottle, and there is also an innovative food menu to complement them. MoNIKa’s wine bar is also a top pick, located in the city centre near Saint Francis Church.
sources.shortName: Best Things To Do In Split in 2025 [by Local Experts] Zen Travel Croatia

places.name: Zinfandel Food & Wine Bistro

reviews.text: We ordered pasta with prawns, seafood risotto, and mussels. All these dishes weren't special, but still tasted good. But the real star of “Zinfandel”'s menu is desserts. We chose cheesecake, kadaif cannelloni, and lemon tart - each looked beautiful and was more than just tasty. One point comes for a good service: our waiter was polite, friendly, and attentive. The only problem in this restaurant is the coffee which tastes terrible. Generally, it's a nice atmosphere in this place, hospitable people, tasty food and live music, so we are delighted.

Excellent dishes. Octopus was prepared to a level I've never had. Not chewy, slight sweet and nutty. Well balanced dish with chickpeas olives etc.

The restaurant is curated to a level consistent and expected from Michelin guide restaurants down to the lighting, live music and 10/10 service.

Not stuffy, pushy just a laid back atmosphere that will keep you coming back when you're in Split.

Highly recommended

I'm from Toronto and I've come to Split the last two years in a row and Zinfandel is always a non-negotiable restaurant. The food is amazing and the staff is so amazing and hospitable. They remembered me and my friend from the year before and welcomed us with warm greetings.

This most recent year, 2025, we went a total of 3 times within a span of 24 hours.

They are also amazing with accommodating to gluten-free and dairy-free restrictions.

Big thank you to Igor who remembered us from last year. Also thank you to Leon and Marina who served us this year also.

places.generalDescription: Experience the adrenaline rush and breathtaking views of Cetina Canyon with Zip Line Split, located in Omis just a short drive from Split. The 800m zipline offers an exhilarating adventure amidst stunning scenery. The friendly staff ensures a safe and enjoyable experience, providing backpacks for belongings and even water bottles. Conveniently meeting at Modesty Bar in the city center, visitors are then driven to the starting point where they receive gear and meet their guides.

sources.snippet: This tours leaves from our Split office at 08h00 and 17h00 returns at about 11h00 and 20h00 respectively. First it’s to our office to choose the bike and safety helmet that fits you best then we stop at various points across the City of Split and visit some great local beaches.
sources.shortName: Best things to do in Split for Couple

sources.snippet: For a heart-pounding thrill and spectacular scenery, go zip lining in the Cetina Canyon. The adventurous can head to Omis, located where the Cetina River meets the Adriatic. just a little over 30 minutes from Split.
sources.shortName: Best Things To Do In Split in 2025 [by Local Experts] Zen Travel Croatia

places.name: Zip Line Split

reviews.text: The best place i have ever been. The instructors were very friendly and kind. The beautiful views are from the all way down by zip line
Awesome dudes. Nice guides. Transfer also included. Best views

It was really awesome and nice ! One of us was afraid of heights and the guides were patient and encouraging. They also had water (free) and toilets. They explain really well. Also, the guy who picked us up in split was very kind and explained us a few things about the area while he was driving. We suggest taking the first slot in the morning or the last one of the day (less hot), there's not a lot of walking but very little shade so be prepared if you do this during the summer. We had a lot of fun !

places.generalDescription: Marjan is a popular recreational area located just west of Split, offering stunning city and harbor views from its forested hilltop. It's a favorite spot for locals to take long walks, go biking, or even engage in alpine climbing on the south side of the hill. The area provides a peaceful escape from the bustling city and boasts beautiful viewpoints, ruins, and small churches to explore.

sources.snippet: While the Riva is a great place for a romantic view, another one of the best views in Split can be enjoyed from Marjan Hill. Covered with dense pine forest, it overlooks the city, the harbour, the sea, and nearby islands from 600 feet above. If you’re up for a trek, there are scenic trails that lead to a 16th-century Jewish centre for a glimpse of Split’s Jewish heritage, along with cave dwellings that were once inhabited by Christian hermits, and multiple lookout points.
sources.shortName: Most Romantic Things To Do In Split

sources.snippet: For those who love nature and scenic views, Marjan Hill is a perfect destination. Located within walking distance of the city center, this green oasis offers panoramic views of Split and the surrounding islands. It’s a haven for walking, cycling, or simply enjoying a quiet picnic.
sources.shortName: Split Travel Guide: Romantic Tips, Attractions & Local Insights
Best Things To Do In Split in 2025 [by Local Experts] Zen Travel Croatia

places.name: Marjan

reviews.text: Marjan is a large forest/park in Split.It has a lot of hiking paths on which you can cycle,jog,run,walk and so on.It is truly beautiful and large.With a lot of viewpoints and attractions it is a must to in Split! (Pictures presented are from the top path of Marjan not the bottom)

Marjan Park is a true gem for nature lovers and those seeking a tranquil escape, often referred to as the "lungs of the city," this area offers a serene retreat from the bustling city center.

The beaches around Marjan Hill, such as Kašjuni Beach and Bene Beach, are less crowded compared to other popular spots in Split. The secluded coves offer a peaceful environment where the sounds of cicadas can lull you into a state of relaxation better than any lullaby.

One of the best ways to enjoy Marjan Beach is by setting up a hammock between the trees, allowing you to fully immerse yourself in the natural beauty.

For those who prefer a more active holiday, the park is perfect for jogging, cycling, and hiking, especially in the early morning or late evening when the temperatures are cooler.
The highlight of visiting Split, beautiful place with amazing views all around. It's possible to get there using the Marjan Steps or through the beautiful mountain park surrounding the place.

places.generalDescription: Restaurant Zrno Soli in Split is a top seafood spot with an impressive team of chefs from around the world, including those with prestigious culinary awards. The young chef Branimir Prnjak leads the kitchen, ensuring fresh ingredients and creative dishes. The restaurant boasts a superb wine list and plans to introduce exclusive options soon. With fantastic views of the marina, it offers innovative and delicious food for those willing to pay a bit more for a memorable dining experience.

sources.snippet: Zrno Soli is a fine dining establishment located in ACI Marina in Sustipan. The restaurant features amazing views over bay towards Riva promenade. It is 10 years old and within that time it became renowned for great quality food and amazing service.
sources.shortName: Where to Stay and Eat in Split in 2022?

sources.snippet: During the hot Split nights with a full moon, especially when you are in a company with your beloved, take a pleasant walk from Riva promenade to prestigious ACI Marina, where a fine dining restaurant Zrno Soli (‘a grain of salt’) is located.
sources.shortName: Split Romantic Restaurants Guide

sources.snippet: We can also recommend restaurants Adriatic Graso and Zrno Soli located near the ACI marina as well as newly opened restaurant F De Mar and the restaurant Re di Mare, located on the other side of town.
sources.shortName: BEST ROMANTIC RESTAURANTS IN SPLIT – Excursion Dalmatia

places.name: Restaurant Zrno Soli

reviews.text:
Overall, this is a great place to have a fine dinner.

The service was great. The server was very attentive and knew the menu very well, he also had great recommendations to make for our dinner. He was knowledgeable when we mentioned that there were food restrictions in our party.

The food was fantastic. We had the best of the best of the Adriatic, we also had the fish soup which was delicious. It was a broth soup with a good chunk of white fish and capers. We also tried the super greens starter. It was fantastic.

The place is not great for Winter dining since it is in the port and relatively separated from the heart of the city. But you could tell that during the summer months when the boating season is live the terrace is very active and the view of the port of Split is fantastic.

We didn't have dessert, but the options looked really attractive.

Overall, you can tell that this place is Michelin guide restaurant and it's well deserved.

Stellar view out over the harbour. Incredible food, we had a variety of cold appetizers that ranged from very good to absolutely outstanding, followed by a grilled John dory fish, cut and served table side. Strongly recommended.
We came here for lunch and loved the views of the harbor. The service was excellent and the fine was really good. We plan on coming back for dinner to experience the 6 course meal!

sources.snippet: If you are thinking of visiting Croatia, join us for a fantastic private 7 day/6 night fully guided tour of the Dalmatian Coast, Croatia and the fascinating Ottoman City of Mostar
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Split

sources.snippet: Here, you’ll find an overview of available tours, highlights of romantic destinations, and essential tips for booking your perfect private boat ride.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Split: Top Activities for Couples

reviews.text: Kruno was so friendly and accommodating! We had such a great experience with him as a driver. He was constantly sharing with us about Croatia, Slovenia and gave us great insights into the Croatian culture and people. It was a very fun experience. He is a very knowledgeable driver. With all the amazing sights, i think the best part was the drive was actually the drive between cities. We jokingly said there should be an attraction “Kruno's Pitstops”. He took us to the best Cream cake! I highly recommend this company, and i seldom write reviews. Thanks also to the tour guides. All were pleasant and knowledgeable.Very enjoyable trip!

I'm a Los Angeles-based tour operator who traveled to Croatia with my mom in May 2025. As this was our first visit to the country, we sought the services of Croatia Private Tours to handle all our sightseeing and transportation. We opted for the 8 day Dubrovnik to Zagreb private tour with an optional excursion in the town of Ston for oyster farming and wine tasting. This optional activity was quite fun! Delicious, freshly shucked oysters straight from the Bay, yum!

All transportation provided was clean and comfortable. We had Kruno for the majority of the time, and he was not only always punctual and professional, but also personable and quite funny! Kruno's a great conversationalist and gave us wonderful insight on Croatian culture, food, and the people. We enjoyed Kruno!

We also had Mate as our driver from Split to Zagreb, and he too, was professional. We also enjoyed talking to Mate about his homeland.

All local guides provided in Dubrovnik, Split/Trogir, Island of Hvar, and Zagreb, were all extremely knowledgeable, friendly, and accommodating. We learned a lot!

If you want to travel to Croatia and have no idea where to begin your search, do not hesitate to reach out to Croatia Private Tours for all your traveling needs!

Ivan was an exceptional driver and guide for our road trip from Zagreb to Dubrovnik, stopping in Zadar and Split along the way.

At just 22 years old, he demonstrated remarkable professionalism and attention to detail. His planning skills ensured we stayed on schedule, and his food recommendations were spot on.

Ivan's helpful nature and well mannerisum made our journey even more enjoyable.

He went above and beyond to assist with luggage and was always willing to lend a hand.

I highly recommend Ivan as a driver and guide. His promising career in tourism is evident in the excellent service he provided. If you're looking for a reliable and knowledgeable guide, Ivan is definitely worth considering.

places.generalDescription: Ovčice is a popular spot in Split, known for its authentic local bar, Kavana Ovcice, where locals gather to enjoy coffee, beer, and wine with a view of the sea. The beach itself is a pebbled stretch that offers a quieter alternative to the bustling Bacvice Beach nearby. Families can spend leisurely days here, indulging in ice cream from nearby vendors or simply soaking up the sun.

sources.shortName: attractions Split, Central Dalmatia

places.name: Ovčice

reviews.text: What a gem... I'm glad I found this place. Super relaxed vibes. Fast friendly service, cheap beer for the location. Great cocktails. Plenty of shade for those hot days. Toilets on hand. Deck chairs for 80 Kuna a day. Went a couple times and would definitely go back. Worth the trip getting there. 25 min walk from Split central.

Great place to get a drink and a snack for the beach.
Staff were lovely and saved me a Greek Salad in their fridge until later.
Cheap and cheerful with a smile!

Horrible customer service. Manager of the place is very dangerous, he's fighting and screaming at the customers. I literally had to leave because I thought he will get physical. Somebody please get some mental help to him this is not a joke.. I ordered white coffee and I got cappuccino with 80% foam, croissant tastes 3 days old. Waste of money and horrible rest of the day. Definitely don't recommend.

places.generalDescription: ST Burek is a renowned establishment in Split, operating since 1983 and offering some of the best burek pastries in the area. This savory snack features flaky filo dough filled with various ingredients like meat, potatoes, cheese, and spinach. It's a popular choice for a quick and affordable meal in Split, with generous portions priced at less than $3. The small shop is known for its traditional lunch menu and is often recommended for takeout due to limited seating.

sources.snippet: It is a small shop, so locals recommend getting takeout from here instead of having a sit-down meal since seating is limited. Many guests love their traditional lunch menu with lots to choose from. The burek served in many forms is highly recommended here.
sources.shortName: 17 Things To Do In Split, Croatia For Families, Singles & Couples

places.name: ST Burek

reviews.text: One of the best borek's I've had in the Balkans that we even came here twice. We ordered the cheese borek and also the meat borek. Both were similarly great so no preference on which one is better. Also the employee working was very nice, spoke great English which is a plus and overall just a place I would highly recommend.

A great spot for a quick bite! The Burek is absolutely delicious and super flaky. The minced meat is a must try, but the potatoes burek is incredibly flavorful. They are a bit on the greasy side, but hey its vacation.

Best Burek ever! Highly recommend! We had the meat, chicken, and cheese and all were fabulous. My mum had a slice of pizza that was also very tasty! Lovely staff and a great experience! Worth a visit when in Split.

places.generalDescription: Restaurant Kadena is a top-tier dining establishment located in the Zenta area, offering breathtaking views of Brac, Soltu, and Hvar from its terrace. The restaurant's elegant interior features an impressive display of over 400 high-quality wines and exclusive decor. Known for its Mediterranean cuisine and molecular gastronomy, Kadena has earned a reputation as one of the most sophisticated restaurants in Split.

sources.snippet: My first recommendation is Kadena restaurant located in eastern part of Split, at Zenta bay. It’s considered as the best Split restaurant.
sources.shortName: Split Romantic Restaurants Guide

places.name: Restaurant Kadena

reviews.text:
Kadena restaurant in Split offers an exceptional dining experience. The ambiance is elegant and cozy, perfect for a relaxing meal. The waiters are professional, unobtrusive, and always ready to assist with recommendations, making the whole experience even more special.

The grilled shrimp are perfectly prepared, while the osso buco is incredibly delicious – definitely the best I've ever had. Every component of the dish is carefully selected and prepared to perfection.

What also sets this restaurant apart is their exclusive selection of Ursaria olive oils, which is a real treat for olive oil enthusiasts.

I highly recommend Kadena to anyone looking for top-notch food and excellent service in Split!

Great service, view and food! The seafood tasted super fresh, and the wine and olive oil were locally produced in Split. The service was brilliant, very friendly and professional staff. The prices are a little bit higher than other places but totally worth it with all you get. 😍

Well-trained staff and tasty food – but overpriced for Split

We visited Restoran Kadena as a family and were given a calm and beautiful table with a lovely view. The staff – at least the one who served us – was professional, well-trained, and contributed to a pleasant dining experience.

We ordered a whole fish for the family, and it was well-prepared and tasted very good. Even our youngest child enjoyed it. To accompany the meal, we ordered a bottle of wine from Skradin for €58, which unfortunately did not live up to our expectations.

The food and service were both good, and the atmosphere was elegant and relaxed. However, when compared to other restaurants in Split offering similar or even better food quality, the prices at Kadena felt significantly overpriced.

We were a family of four, and for one bottle of wine, one iced tea, and two bottles of water – along with the food – we paid €310. That is extremely expensive, especially for being in Split, where you can have excellent meals for far less.

If the prices had been more aligned with the overall experience, I would have gladly given 4 stars. But as it stands, the high cost overshadows the otherwise positive impressions.

places.address: Ul. Ivana pl. Zajca 4, 21000, Split, Croatia

places.generalDescription: Konoba Fratelli is a Mediterranean restaurant located just west of Split's Old Town, offering traditional Italian and Croatian dishes at budget-friendly prices. The menu includes flavorful seafood, pizza, and pasta dishes. Visitors can enjoy a delightful dining experience with an incredible ambiance featuring terrace seating adorned with string lights. The restaurant is highly recommended for seafood lovers and offers a variety of options for vegetarians as well. Guests have praised the delicious food, especially the incomparable pizza, and appreciated the attentive wait staff.

sources.snippet: Konoba Fratelli was probably my favorite restaurant of the entire trip, and that is saying a lot. The location is quiet, it is laid back and casual, and the menu offers something for everyone. Their entrees are light yet incredibly flavorful, and it feels as if they make everything with the freshest of ingredients.
sources.shortName: Split Croatia for Couples

places.name: Konoba Fratelli

reviews.text:
Perfect restaurant with traditional Italian food and a truly authentic vibe!
We ordered a carbonara, which was a solid 9/10, and a Capricciosa pizza that was a perfect 10/10. The waiter was very friendly and quick, and the food came out fast as well!
The flavors were delicious and genuinely traditional. We sat outside - the terrace is lovely on summer days. lovely dishes!!
I'm going back tonight for dinner, it was that good!

10/10
Tastiest seafood we've eaten! The service was great, the waiter was always polite and attentive, we didn't have to wait between meals. Would recommend to anyone visiting Split, 10/10

The food was incredible! Atmosphere was great and the cocktails were wonderful too. The line was long but went decently quick, and we're so happy we waited. The truffle shrimp macaroni was delicious, and the garlic bread with olive oil and balsamic was amazing. Wish we were in town longer, we would've eaten here multiple times!

places.generalDescription: Brasserie on 7, also known as B7, is a casual eatery located on the Riva waterfront in Split. It offers a diverse menu featuring breakfast, pasta, seafood, and meat dishes along with pastries, coffee, and craft beer. The restaurant is praised for its lovely staff and great views without loud music. It's a popular spot for digital nomad meetups during the off-peak season from September to May when it's less crowded and more affordable.

sources.snippet: Brasserie on 7 is a sort of extension of already well established Zinfandel, sharing ownership and philosophy with it. It's been opened at one of the most central locations in the city, in the middle of main seaside promenade Riva. This restaurant became one of the new stars of Split gastronomy, with nice selection of re-defined local and international dishes.
sources.shortName: Split restaurants | Restaurants

sources.snippet: During Napoleon’s occupancy, the Splitska Riva was once known as the French Riva and held its name long after his departure. The B7 executive chef utilizes principles of French gastronomy to highlight Croatian cuisine and presents it on a world-class scale. It has an impressive harbor setting with a stylish and timeless interior, quality of service, and a consistent standard of cuisine.
sources.shortName: 17 Things To Do In Split, Croatia For Families, Singles & Couples

places.name: Brasserie on 7

reviews.text:
Great experience overall! The service was very friendly and professional. All the staff wear the same colorful shirts, which adds to the good vibe of the place. I was especially impressed by how much attention they pay to the little details - I saw staff carefully adjusting cutlery and menus to perfection, which really shows their dedication.

There's a wide variety of breakfast options. I went with the B7 breakfast, and it was absolutely delicious. If you're really hungry, I can confidently say most dishes here will satisfy your appetite.

They also offer a great selection of juices - all very fresh and tasty for the warm weather.

And to top it all off, the view of the sea is absolutely beautiful. 🌊

We visited Brasserie on 7 everyday during our recent holiday in Split as it was nearby our hotel. The breakfast menu had a good variety of options available and I tried to have something different everyday. The staff were very friendly, helpful and attentive. The restaurant is in a lovely location overlooking the water. The food was all great and the portions are very generous.

Massive fan of this place despite the 2 year old review. The staff here were extremely friendly, and the food was excellent. Particularly the meats and cheese board: I found the meats here less salty than their Italian equivalents. The cheeses were excellent, especially the sheep cheese that paired perfectly with the fig jam.

places.address: Obala Hrvatskog narodnog preporoda 7, 21000, Split, Croatia
